author: Dan Alexander
title: NJ wildfire season takes off with 'suspicious' blaze among 230 fires so far - NewsBreak
text:
1057thehawk.com
website
New Jersey
NJ wildfire season takes off with ‚Äòsuspicious‚Äô blaze among 230 fires so far
By Dan Alexander,
13 minutes agoüî• A fallen powerline sparked the Hopewell wildfire. üî• The Forest Fire Service is joining the investigation of the Pennsville wildfire. üî• There have already been 230 wildfires in NJ this year. NOTE: The story has been updated to show the correct number of wildfires so far...

author: Anadolu Agency
title: Main opposition leader slams US for turning blind eye to killing of Turkish-American activist - T√ºrkiye Today
text:
T√ºrkiye‚Äôs main opposition Republican People‚Äôs Party (CHP) leader Ozgur Ozel criticized the US on Thursday for failing to stand up for Aysenur Ezgi Eygi , Turkish American activist killed by Israeli soldiers in the West Bank.
Recommended All about Israel's latest victim: Turkish-American activist Aysenur Ezgi Eygi Could activist Aysenur Eygi‚Äôs killing influence ICJ case against Israel? US VP Kamala Harris calls for accountability in killing of Aysenur Ezgi Eygi Speaking to journalists at the Turkish House in New York, where T√ºrkiye‚Äôs Consulate General and Permanent Mission to the U.N. are located, Ozel said: ‚ÄúThe U.S. derives its strength from protecting its citizens wherever they are in the world. However, the U.S. could not stand up for its citizen Aysenur because Israel is its soft underbelly.‚Äù
Funeral prayer held for Turkish American activist Aysenur Ezgi Eygi at Didim Central Mosque in Didim distict, Aydin, T√ºrkiye on September 14, 2024. (AA Photo) Eygi, 26, a dual Turkish U.S. national, was killed by Israeli forces on Sept. 6 during a peaceful protest against illegal Israeli settlements near Nablus in the occupied West Bank.
The CHP leader, in New York for the Socialist International Presidium meeting, said he largely focused on the Palestinian issue during his three-day program.
Ozel said he also met Ersin Tatar, president of the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus, who is in New York for the U.N. week, reaffirming his party‚Äôs commitment to the Cyprus issue.
He praised the Turkish House building as ‚Äúa source of pride for all,‚Äù expressing the party‚Äôs desire to hold programs at the facility.

author: Rafaella Plaza
title: La banda No Te Va Gustar celebra 30 a√±os de carrera musical con dos conciertos en Ecuador y confiesa estar en su mejor momento
text: Fue en 1994 cuando la banda uruguaya No Te Va Gustar se form√≥ como un cuarteto compuesto por los amigos Emiliano Brancciari, Gonzalo Castex, Mateo Moreno y Pablo Abdala, quienes decidieron armar un grupo para presentarse en un festival colegial. Hoy, despu√©s de tres d√©cadas, han pasado por varios cambios art√≠sticos y de integrantes, consagr√°ndose como una de las agrupaciones m√°s influyentes y escuchadas dentro la escena del rock latinoamericano. Actualmente est√° conformada por Brancciari, Denis Ramos, Guzm√°n Silveira, Diego Bartaburu, Mauricio Ortiz, Mart√≠n Gil, Pablo Coniberti y Francisco Nasser. Ellos conversaron v√≠a Zoom con Diario EL UNIVERSO acerca de su pasado, presente y futuro. Publicidad A pesar de que su m√°s reciente canci√≥n se titula Me cans√©, el grupo no planea parar ni cansarse por nada y sigue preparando sorpresas para sus seguidores y fan√°ticos. Este nuevo single, compuesto inicialmente por Silveira en 2014, es una colaboraci√≥n con la artista argentina Zoe Gotusso y fue lanzado el pasado 12 de enero, abriendo as√≠ su 2024. ‚ÄúLo que algunos no saben es que esta es una canci√≥n que ya ten√≠a muchos a√±os, pero no hab√≠a entrado a ning√∫n disco, hasta que el a√±o pasado decidimos sacar varias in√©ditas‚Äù, dijo Ramos, quien agreg√≥ que trabajar junto con Gotusso fue una experiencia satisfactoria. Publicidad ‚ÄúElla es una cantautora argentina joven con mucha energ√≠a, nosotros ya la conoc√≠amos desde hace algunos a√±os. La canci√≥n necesitaba una voz femenina y ella era la ideal. Se adapt√≥ r√°pidamente a nuestra din√°mica y estilo‚Äù, continu√≥ diciendo. Despu√©s de tanto tiempo, ¬øcu√°l es el sonido actual de No Te Va Gustar? Bueno, intentamos estar actualizados con las nuevas formas de hacer m√∫sica, porque nosotros somos de la √©poca de los 90, cuando era todo m√°s an√°logo, y eso es algo que para nosotros siempre ha sido fundamental. Con la llegada de Francisco Nasser a la banda en el 2013, hemos incorporado un sonido m√°s moderno, fusionando distintos g√©neros musicales. Publicidad Si bien estamos cumpliendo 30 a√±os, siempre intentamos estar a la vanguardia de eso, de estar presente en los nuevos sonidos y las nuevas maneras de escuchar m√∫sica en todas las plataformas digitales que hay ahora. ¬øC√≥mo se sienten al cumplir 30 a√±os de carrera musical? Este punto es el mejor momento de la banda, la verdad que estamos en un muy buen momento en lo musical y humano. Esto √∫ltimo para nosotros es un pilar fundamental, mantener a la familia unida para poder salir a presentar la m√∫sica de la banda a diferentes pa√≠ses. Estamos felices tambi√©n de conocer nuevas ciudades. √öltimamente venimos hablando bastante de esto, porque claro, en cada momento que la banda fue cumpliendo a√±os redondos, digamos 10, 15, 20 y 25, se conversa y se hace como repaso de lo que ha pasado hasta ese momento. Estamos alegres con la carrera que hemos hecho y con todo lo que se viene. El nuevo √°lbum de NTVG Con el √∫ltimo lanzamiento, que fue Me cans√©, la agrupaci√≥n uruguaya se enfocar√° en completar todas las fechas de su tour 30 A√±os, que termina el 27 de julio en el Movistar Arena de Chile. Despu√©s de la gira, la banda har√° una pausa de los escenarios para concentrarse en la composici√≥n y grabaci√≥n de un nuevo disco para el a√±o 2025. Publicidad Concierto de No Te Va Gustar en Ecuador En el marco de su aniversario n√∫mero 30, la banda se encuentra en medio de una gira internacional que la llevar√° a pisar tierras ecuatorianas. Son dos conciertos que ofrecer√°n en dos ciudades del pa√≠s, y las entradas se pueden adquirir a trav√©s de la p√°gina web de Ticket Show. El primer show ser√° man√±ana, viernes 1 de marzo, a las 19:00, en el Teatro Nacional CCE de Quito. La segunda fecha prevista ser√° al d√≠a siguiente, el s√°bado 2 de marzo a las 20:00, en el Teatro Carlos Cueva Tamariz de Cuenca. ‚ÄúVamos a estar en Cuenca, que es una ciudad a la que nunca fuimos, y eso nos motiva tambi√©n para continuar con ese fuego y esa emoci√≥n de cantar. Estuvimos en Quito el a√±o pasado por primera vez y la verdad que nos llevamos una gran sorpresa de la gente ecuatoriana y por eso tambi√©n decidimos regresar‚Äù, confiesa Ramos. Si asiste a uno de estos espect√°culos, podr√° ser testigo de un repertorio que fusiona los diez discos de estudio de NTVG, en el que se encuentran sus cl√°sicos m√°s recordados, como A las nueve, Ese maldito momento, Chau, y m√°s. - Entradas Quito: Luneta alta $ 36,50; luneta baja $ 56,50; vip $ 76,50; Star Box $ 96,50. - Entradas Cuenca: Platea A $ 41,50; vip $ 56,50; Star Box $ 71,50. (E)

author: Robby Payne
title: The Masters website is everything I love about the open web
text: The Masters tournament is underway, and yet again The Masters website/PWA [(masters.com)](https://masters.com/) is blowing my mind as it continues to push the envelope of how we experience big golf tournaments on the web. This year, as it has done for the past few years, the website‚Äôs capabilities and focus on personalized fan experience make it one of my favorite parts of tuning in for this legendary event. You won‚Äôt find this kind of coverage anywhere else and it is the ultimate companion for keeping up with your favorites at The Masters. Calling this a ‚Äúwebsite‚Äù feels like calling my Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 5 a ‚Äúphone.‚Äù This is far more than an informative place to read info. It‚Äôs an all-out interactive experience. Want to track a single player across every hole? Done! Want a personalized feed featuring your favorite stars? It‚Äôs a few clicks away. Imagine shot tracers visualizing ball trajectories in real-time, right beside live video! And with the ability to see the tournament‚Äôs biggest highlights, you won‚Äôt miss a single iconic moment. The awesomeness of the open web For avid fans like me, this feel just as revolutionary as the first time I used it. This morning, though he‚Äôs not on broadcast TV, I am still following Bryson DeChambeau hole by hole, witnessing every monster drive and each par save on his way to the field-leading -3. It‚Äôs been awesome, and the open web is a perfect platform for this sort of thing, not requiring that anyone download anything. Just log on and watch who you want, when you want. Even if golf isn‚Äôt your thing, the sheer technical brilliance of [masters.com](https://masters.com/) is a testament to the modern web‚Äôs potential. It‚Äôs a masterclass in web development that you can take full advantage of on your Chromebook, and that‚Äôs worth celebrating. Those of us who love Chromebooks understand that they‚Äôre about way more than just browsing. Experiences like The Masters website are the future ‚Äì powerful web tools that leave traditional, native apps behind in favor of a connected, always-updated solution. Chromebooks are built for this kind of innovation, and The Masters website is delivering on those capabilities in pretty spectacular fashion. If you haven‚Äôt experienced it yet, go give it a try!

author: Nathaniel Puente
title: Teen found locked behind trapped door, man arrested | wcnc.com
text:
LINCOLN COUNTY, Ky. ‚Äî A man accused of taking a teenager from North Carolina to be trapped in his home in Kentucky is facing over a dozen charges.
The Lincoln County Sheriff's Office in Kentucky says Zackary Jones, 34, kept a 16-year-old girl behind a trapped door in his home for two to three weeks. Police were called to the home on Dec. 25 after Jones' mother reported a domestic violence altercation to the sheriff's office between Jones and "his girlfriend," according to an arrest citation.
Jones told deputies when they arrived that the girl was not at the home. Deputies found drug paraphernalia in the home and took Jones into custody, according to the citation.
Deputies continued to search the home and found the teenager inside a trap door that was hidden under a rug in the bedroom, according to the citation.
The girl told deputies that Jones sexually assaulted her and was using crack cocaine with her. Deputies learned that the teenager was reported missing in Fayetteville in early December.
Jones told deputies that he picked up the girl from her home in Fayetteville and admitted to doing sexual acts with the teenager, according to the citation.
The teenager told authorities that Jones told her he was 19 years old when he drove to meet her. She learned his real age when they arrived at his home in Kentucky where he threatened her and told her to tell his family that she was 18, according to the citation.
While Jones was driving the teenager to Kentucky, they were stopped by a Lincoln County deputy for a traffic violation, according to the citation. The teenager says Jones told her he would shoot the deputy if they were asked to get out of the vehicle.
Jones is facing over a dozen charges, including:
Rape Sodomy Proc or prom use of minor by electronic means Terroristic threatening Assault Strangulation Two charges of Unlawful transaction with a minor Resisting arrest Unlawful imprisonment Buying or possessing drug paraphernalia Possession of a controlled substance Tampering with physical evidence The arrest citation says that the teenager's guardian will be facing charges in North Carolina. At this time, it's unclear what those charges are.
